channel.title: App Repositories on
channel.description: Recent content in App Repositories on

item.title: Add an App Repository
item.description:
This section describes how to add an app repository to the KubeSphere platform.

Prerequisites

  • You should have the App Store Management permission on the KubeSphere platform. For more information, refer to "Platform Roles".

  • KubeSphere App Store Management should have been installed and enabled.

  • A Helm Chart repository has been created in advance. For information on how to create a Helm Chart repository, see the Helm Documentation.

Steps

  1. Log in to the KubeSphere web console with a user who has the App Store Management permission.

  2. Click in the upper-right corner and select App Store Management.

  3. Click App Repositories in the left navigation pane.

  4. Click Add on the page.

  5. In the Add App Repository dialog, set the parameters for the app repository, then click OK.

    Parameter Description

    Name

item.title: View App Repository List
item.description:
This section describes how to view the app repository list.

Prerequisites

  • You should have the App Store Management permission on the KubeSphere platform. For more information, refer to "Platform Roles".

  • KubeSphere App Store Management should have been installed and enabled.

Steps

  1. Log in to the KubeSphere web console with a user who has the App Store Management permission.

  2. Click in the upper-right corner and select App Store Management.

  3. Click App Repositories in the left navigation pane.

    • The app repository list provides the following information:

      Parameter Description

      Name

item.title: Edit App Repositories
item.description:
This section describes how to edit an app repository.

Prerequisites

  • You should have the App Store Management permission on the KubeSphere platform. For more information, refer to "Platform Roles".

  • KubeSphere App Store Management should have been installed and enabled.

Steps

  1. Log in to the KubeSphere web console with a user who has the App Store Management permission.

  2. Click in the upper-right corner and select App Store Management.

  3. Click App Repositories in the left navigation pane.

  4. Click on the right side of the app repository you want to edit, then select Edit Information from the dropdown list.

  5. In the Edit App Repository dialog, set the parameters for the app repository, then click OK.

    Parameter Description

    Name

item.title: Delete an App Repository
item.description:
This section describes how to delete an app repository.

Warning

After an app repository is deleted, users will not be able to install apps from the repository. Please proceed with caution.

Prerequisites

  • You should have the App Store Management permission on the KubeSphere platform. For more information, refer to "Platform Roles".

  • KubeSphere App Store Management should have been installed and enabled.
